title: Alan Shearer questions whether Liverpool have the right "attitude" to win Premier League after Swansea defeat
text:
Sport Alan Shearer questions whether Liverpool have the right "attitude" to win Premier League after Swansea defeat The Reds slipped up against Swansea on Saturday and Shearer asks whether they have what it takes to win the title Share   Alan Shearer questions Liverpool's title credentials Share this video Get Liverpool FC   
Alan Shearer believes there is an issue with "attitude and application" at Liverpool following their 3-2 defeat by Swansea on Saturday. 
Jurgen Klopp's men currently find themselves third in the Premier League table and have performed well against sides in the top six. 
On the opening day of the season they beat Arsenal 4-3 at the Emirates before beating Chelsea 2-1 at Stamford Bridge in September. 
They also beat Manchester City in December and picked up draws against Tottenham in August and rivals Manchester United in October and January. Alan Shearer believes there is an issue with "attitude and application" at Liverpool (Photo: BBC) Jurgen Klopp's men were beaten 3-2 by Swansea on Saturday (Photo: Getty) 
But despite their strong performances against the clubs competing alongside them for the ultimate prize in English football, they have slipped up in other games. 
After their win over the Gunners they were beaten 2-0 by Burnley, before losing away at Bournemouth in December and picking up a point against Sunderland in January. 
Speaking on BBC Match of the Day in the above video, Shearer suggests there may be an "attitude" problem at Anfield. Liverpool went 2-0 down before drawing level and losing the game to a late Gylfi Sigurdsson goal (Photo: Getty) 
He praises Klopp's men for their performances against the top six, and points out that they are unbeaten in games against them. 
But suggests the players have to apply themselves in the same way against teams battling further down the league if they are to be serious title contenders. poll loading Is there an "attitude and application" problem at Liverpool? 0+ VOTES SO FAR
